info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:15PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GOOCHLAND...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...SOUTHEASTERN POWHATAN...CHESTERFIELD...WEST CENTRAL CHARLES CITY...NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...HENRICO...WEST CENTRAL KING WILLIAM AND EAST CENTRAL AMELIA COUNTIES...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL...THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF PETERSBURG AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 614 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bon Air, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Bon Air, University Of Richmond and Chesterfield Court House around 625 PM EDT. Richmond and Downtown Richmond around 630 PM EDT. Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, Bensley, Bellwood and East Highland Park around 635 PM EDT. Highland Springs around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Enfield, Richmond Heights, Birchett Estate, Jordan Point Country Club, Montrose, Petersburg National Battlefield, Sandston, Glendale, Pocahontas State Park and Richmond International. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
